ngiemboon: Samîɛ la gɔɔn mbwó pa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm ngie: «N ka gÿo kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie pi ka zɛ́te mbwó mèŋ; n nǎa fùɔ gẅie à ge sáʼa gẅí.
en: Then Samuel said to all Israel, “I have carefully listened to everything you said to me and placed a king over you.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, afùɔ gẅie à ge ne tsyeen gẅí wɛ̂. N kéen ńzẅiŋ, tà twó yɔ́ɔn fɔ́g. Penkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn pembàŋa giŋé ńgwɔ́ yɔ́b melÿò páʼ pi. Ńgʉa na mèŋ, mbà n gee lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńtsyeen gẅí páʼɔɔn, tà fó fʉ̀ʼ gie n da nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔshùm.
en: Now you can see that the king is leading you. As for me, I’m old and gray, and my sons are here with you. I have led you from my youth until now.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ wɔɔn ńtyé mvfò pi, á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tà mbɔɔ mvfò fùɔ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tsɔ́ʼ, pi gɔɔn kà pi ne ńdaʼa wɔ́ɔn na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́ɔ. N dǎ kẅé fòŋ wɔ̌? Ńkẅé nzikáasè wɔ̌? N dǎ ké ńgwága wɔ̌? N dǎ nɔʼɔ wɔ̌? N dǎ kẅé lepuʼú mbwó wɔ̌, lélɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ pwó na nò? Pi lɔɔn shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn, mbà mèŋ n ge tsɔ́ʼ sɛ̌ shúm né pi.»
en: Here I am. Bring charges against me before the Lord and his anointed: Whose ox or donkey have I taken?   Who have I wronged or mistreated? Who gave me a bribe to overlook something?  # 12:3 LXX reads bribe or a pair of shoes? Testify against me.,# 12:3 Dt 16:19 I will return it to you.”

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «ɔ̀ laa wég nɔʼɔ, ńké te nò tepòŋ na peg gÿo, ńké te zẅíŋ tsɔ́ lepuʼú lɔg ńkwɛ́ɛ pwó wɔ́.»
en: “You haven’t wronged us, you haven’t mistreated us, and you haven’t taken anything from anyone,” they responded.

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pɔ́ fùɔ ée pajÿòngyá á na nò gie pi fóo légɔɔn lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, á na páʼ pi te ne ńdaʼa wɔ́ɔn na tsɔ́ mmó wɔ́.» Aláʼ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Áa kwàʼ nénʉ́!»
en: He said to them, “The Lord is a witness against you, and his anointed is a witness today that you haven’t found anything   in my hand.”  # 12:5 Ex 22:4

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gíŋe gɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a áa njÿòngyá, yé gẅie à la cʉa na Mǒonsê pɔ́ Áloŋ ńgÿo metá pí fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.
en: Then Samuel said to the people, “The Lord, who appointed Moses and Aaron   and who brought your ancestors up from the land of Egypt, is a witness.  # 12:6 LXX; MT omits is a witness

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pege gʉa mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; à ŋaga wégè. N ge kímte menò mbòŋo mie à la gÿo na pi tà mbɔɔ na pamángʉanjʉʼ pí.
en: Now present yourselves, so I may confront you before the Lord about all the righteous acts he has done for you and your ancestors.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie Yakwɔ̂b la gʉa tà ńkúu Egíbtò, métá pí gaʼte mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; Cʉ̀apʉ̀a túmo Mǒonsê pɔ́ Áloŋ, pɔ́ gʉa ńgÿo metá pí fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pɔ́ cʉ́ʼʉ ńtsẅé pɔ́ na yɔɔn jʉʼ.
en: “When Jacob went to Egypt,   your ancestors cried out to the Lord,  # 12:8 Ex 2:23–25 and he sent them Moses and Aaron, who led your ancestors out of Egypt and settled them in this place.  # 12:8 Ex 3:1–10

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pamángʉanjʉʼ pí la lege Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yɔb. Á leen ńké sẅiŋe wɔ́b mbwó Sizèla, á tándá palÿɔ́ʼncù we Atsɔ̂ɔ, mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a Filisi tà mbɔɔ mbwó fùɔ pà Mowab. Pɔ́ lÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b né ncù.
en: But they forgot the Lord their God, so he handed them over to Sisera   commander of the army of Hazor, to the Philistines, and to the king of Moab.  # 12:9 Jdg 2:11–15 These enemies fought against them.

ngiemboon: Pamángʉanjʉʼ pí la gaʼte mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn ngie: Peg ka fʉa nò mbwó gù mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a! Peg ka gwáʼa gú, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńguʼte pɔ́ messé Mbâa mbɔɔ mé Asetáatè; Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, kẅé wég mbwó megàŋmbù, peg cʉ́ʼʉ faʼa pɔ́ mbwó gù!
en: Then they cried out to the Lord and said, ‘We have sinned, for we abandoned the Lord and worshiped the Baals and the Ashtoreths. Now rescue us from the power of our enemies,   and we will serve you.’

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la túmo Yelubâa, mbɔɔ Mbendaŋ, mbɔɔ Jÿɛbte ńgÿo mèŋ Samîɛ. À la kẅé gẅí mbwó megàŋmbù pie é laa lejʉ́ŋ pi, pi cʉ́ʼ ńnéŋe pɔ́ te pɔ́g.
en: So the Lord sent Jerubbaal,   Barak,  # 12:11 LXX, Syr; MT reads Bedan; Jdg 4:6; Heb 11:32,# 12:11 Jdg 4:6; 11:1 Jephthah,  # 12:11 Jdg 11:1 and Samuel.  # 12:11 1Sm 7:10–14 He rescued you from the power of the enemies around you, and you lived securely.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi la gwɔ́ tà ńgyá Naháshÿè, á fùɔ pà Amoŋ tó lélÿɔ́ʼɔ gẅí, pi gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: Peg ne ńkwoŋo légẅiin fùɔ! Tá mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gi, zɔɔ fùɔ gẅi.
en: But when you saw that Nahash king of the Ammonites was coming against you, you said to me, ‘No, we must have a king reign over us’ #— #even though the Lord your God is your king.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi gẅiin fùɔ gẅie pi ka tsɔ̌ʼ, pi ka lǔɔ; Cʉ̀apʉ̀a náa mbwó pi.
en: “Now here is the king you’ve chosen,   the one you requested.  # 12:13 1Sm 8:5; Hs 13:11 Look, this is the king the Lord has placed over you.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ḿbɔ́gɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńjúʼ ncwò wé, éfaʼa mbwó yé, ḿbiŋ te tʉʉ twó na membʉ̌ mé wɔ́, pi lâ fùɔ gẅi piŋ ńcʉ́me nzèm yé, mbà kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gí wɔ́ɔ ge tɔ́g pɔ́ mboŋó.
en: If you fear the Lord,   worship and obey him, and if you don’t rebel against the Lord’s command, then both you and the king who reigns over you will follow the Lord your God.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi lɔɔn ńké te júʼ ncwò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́, ńtʉʉ twó na membʉ̌ mé, mbà à ge nyɛ metʉ̀ mé mbwó pi, ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ à la nyɛɛ mbwó pamángʉanjʉʼ pí.
en: However, if you disobey the Lord    and rebel against his command, the Lord’s hand will be against you  # 12:15 1Sm 5:9 as it was against your ancestors.  # 12:15 LXX against you and against your king,# 12:15 Lv 26:14–33; Jos 24:14–27

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi tyé mboŋó, ńgyá nò mɔɔnmɔɔn gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo menÿɔ́g pi.
en: “Now, therefore, present yourselves and see this great thing that the Lord will do before your eyes.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn té fʉʼʉ lùm gie mé ée ḿbwɔ́ʼɔ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ waa? N ge tóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à leen ńké ńgÿo lefaŋ vɛ́te, mbʉ̀ŋ lú. À cʉa púʼu, pi gyá ngie fùɔ gẅie pi ka lúɔ, pi ka gÿo púʼu, ńdɔg ńkwaʼ fʉa tɛʼ á menÿɔ́g Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Isn’t the wheat harvest today?   I will call on the Lord, and he will send thunder and rain so that you will recognize what an immense evil you committed in the Lord’s sight by requesting a king for yourselves.”  # 12:17 1Sm 8:7

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; pɔ́ kwàʼ na yɛ̌ lyɛ̌ʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gÿo lefaŋ vɛ́te, mbʉ̀ŋ lú. Aláʼa ntsèm pú ńcÿɔʼ tɛʼ, ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pɔ́ Samîɛ.
en: Samuel called on the Lord, and on that day the Lord sent thunder and rain. As a result, all the people greatly feared the Lord and Samuel.

ngiemboon: Aláʼa ntsèm gɔɔn né Samîɛ ngie: Sẅíŋte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, e Ssé jù, á na peg megàŋafàʼ pú, tá à cʉa púʼu, peg le kwéte. Mélàʼmie peg ka giŋé ńkẅiʼi, éfʉa nò, á gwɔ́ lélúɔ fùɔ.»
en: They pleaded with Samuel, “Pray to the Lord your God for your servants   so we won’t die! For we have added to all our sins the evil of requesting a king for ourselves.”  # 12:19 1Sm 17:20

ngiemboon: Samîɛ gɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: Tà pi pɔ́g! Pi ka pǔ ńgÿo yɔɔn nò tepòŋ. Táʼ, tà pi fó lejʉ́ŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́, pi faʼa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gẅí ntsèm.
en: Samuel replied, “Don’t be afraid. Even though you have committed all this evil, don’t turn away from following the Lord.   Instead, worship the Lord with all your heart.

ngiemboon: Tà pi fó lejʉ́ŋ yé ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́, ńcʉ́me nzèm messé tepòŋ, mélàʼmie é té kẅéte, ḿbiŋ te kuʼu légÿo nyìŋ tsẅɛ́ wɔ́. Ńtí nue, é zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ messé tepòŋ.
en: Don’t turn away to follow worthless   things that can’t profit or rescue you; they are worthless.  # 12:21 Is 44:9–20; Jr 2:8,11; Hab 2:18

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a te gÿo gwáʼ pʉ̀a pé wɔ́, mélàʼmie lezíŋ sé ée selÿò: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la kwoŋo lélɔgɔ gẅí ńgÿo pʉ̀a pé.
en: The Lord will not abandon his people,   because of his great name and because he has determined to make you his own people.  # 12:22 Dt 7:6–9; 1Pt 2:9

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n těen ńdáʼa fʉ̀a nò mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á le nyé té sẅíŋte Ssé twó pi wɔ́! N ge gÿo zíʼi gẅí mánzsè gẅie aa mbòŋ, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ.
en: “As for me, I vow that I will not sin against the Lord by ceasing to pray for you.   I will teach you the good and right way.

ngiemboon: Ndàʼ ngie pi pɔ́gɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ faʼa mbwó yé páʼ lepʉ̌ ne ńzɛ́te, né ngwòŋ ntʉ́m gẅí ntsèm: Pi gyá memǎa shúm sie à ka gÿo na pi.
en: Above all, fear the Lord and worship him faithfully with all your heart; consider the great things he has done for you.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pi lɔɔn ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, mbà pi ge kwéte, tà mbɔɔ fùɔ gẅi.
en: However, if you continue to do what is evil, both you and your king will be swept away.”
